admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund:
TF040117-MONGOLIA: PREPARATION OF
            ENVIRONMENTAL CODE OF PRACTICE,TF039416-MONGOLIA - TRANSPORT
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF036118-MONGOLIA - TRANSPORT
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Development Project, will
            improve accessibility to the isolated, and remote central,
            and western regions of Mongolia, and, increase transport
            capacity for rail-borne export trade. The components
            include: 1) reconstruction of the paved road from Erdenesant
            to Arvaikheer, based on technical, and economic assessments
            for alternative types of rehabilitation, of some twenty six
            sections of the road, of which, those with the highest
            weighed economic rate of returns, were selected for
            improvement. In addition, short sections of the road from
            Arvaikheer to Khovd, will be upgraded, to provide an
            all-weather gravel surface, with additional short sections
            of the road from Kharkorin to Tosontsengel, improved as
            well, with an all-weather gravel surface; 2) technical
            assistance (TA), and training provision, to support the
            advisory Road Board, including co-sponsoring visits to other
            transition countries, with similar, and established road
            boards. The component will complement a grant from Sweden,
            which provides training in contract management to the
            Department of Roads personnel; 3) road safety, and
            implementation of a system of registration, and inspection
            of road vehicles, complementing inspection facilities,
            funded by previous operations, with additional testing lines
            for trucks, and light vehicles; 4) supply of maintenance
            equipment to ensure road maintenance; and, 5) TA to
            establish the railway financial accounting system, to
            complement the existing management information system, thus,
            facilitate the use of financial, and physical resources.
